v.v: God whom I praise, do not be silent,
For the wicked and deceitful attack me;
They surround me and say hateful things,
In return for my love they accuse me,
They repay me evil for good,
Appoint a wicked man over such an enemy as these people;
When he is judged, may he be found guilty;
May his days be few;
May his children be fatherless,
May his children wander about and beg,
May the creditor take all he owns;
May no one extend any kindness to him;
May his children be cut off;
May his ancestors’ sins be mentioned to Yahweh;
May their guilt always be before Yahweh;
May Yahweh do this because this man never bothered to show any covenant faithfulness,
He loved cursing; may it come back upon him.
He clothed himself with cursing as his garment,
May his curses be to him like the clothes he wears to cover himself,
May this be the reward of my accusers from Yahweh,
Yahweh my Lord, deal kindly with me for your name’s sake.
For I am oppressed and needy,
I am fading away like the shadow of the evening;
My knees are weak from fasting;
I am disdained by my accusers;
Help me, Yahweh my God;
May they know that this is your doing,
Though they curse me, please bless me;
May my adversaries be clothed with shame;
With my mouth I give great thanks to Yahweh;
For he will stand at the right hand of the one who is needy,

v: they speak lies against me.
and they attack me without cause.
but I pray for them.
and they hate my love.
appoint an accuser to stand at his right hand.
may his prayer be considered sinful.
may another take his office.
and may his wife be a widow.
asking for handouts as they leave their ruined home.
may strangers plunder what he earns.
may no one have pity on his fatherless children.
may their name be blotted out in the next generation.
and may the sin of his mother not be forgotten.
may Yahweh cut off their memory from the earth.
but instead harassed the oppressed, the needy,
and the disheartened to death.
He hated blessing; may no blessing come to him.
and his curse came into his inner being like water,
like oil into his bones.
like the belt he always wears.
of those who say evil things about me.
Because your covenant faithfulness is good, save me.
and my heart is wounded within me.
I am shaken off like a locust.
I am turning to skin and bones.
when they see me, they shake their heads.
save me by your covenant faithfulness.
that you, Yahweh, have done this.
when they attack, may they be put to shame,
but may your servant rejoice.
may they wear their shame like a robe.
I will praise him in the midst of a crowd.
to save him from those who judge him.
